summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In the former treatise, O Theophilus, I have given an account of all that Jesus began both to do and teach
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the day in which He was taken up, after He had given commandments through the Holy Ghost unto the apostles, whom He had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To these also He showed Himself alive after His passion by many infallible proofs, being seen by them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the Kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being assembled together with them, He commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, “which,” saith He, “ye have heard from Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for John truly baptized with water, but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they therefore had come together, they asked of Him, saying, “Lord, wilt Thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto them, “It is not for you to know the times or the seasons which the Father hath put in His own power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall receive power after the Holy Ghost is come upon you; and ye shall be witnesses unto Me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had spoken these things, while they beheld, He was taken up, and a cloud received Him out of their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they looked steadfastly toward heaven as He went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also said, “Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? This same Jesus, who is taken up from you into Heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen Him go into Heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a Sabbath day’s journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come in, they went up into an upper room where abode both Peter and James, and John and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot, and Judas the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (the number of names altogether were about a hundred and twenty) and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men and brethren, it was necessary that this Scripture be fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spoke before concerning Judas, who was the guide to those who took Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained a part of this ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the middle, and all his bowels gushed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem, insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Akel Dama, that is to say, the Field of Blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written in the book of Psalms: ‘Let his habitation be desolate, and let no man dwell therein’; and, ‘His bishopric let another take.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore from these men who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beginning from the baptism of John until that same day that He was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of His resurrection.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they appointed two: Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they prayed and said, “Thou, Lord, who knowest the hearts of all men, show us which of these two Thou hast chosen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that he may take part of this ministry and apostleship from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast their lots, and the lot fell upon Matthias; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost and began to speak in other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men out of every nation under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together and were confounded, because every man heard them speaking in his own language.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed and marveled, saying one to another, “Behold, are not all these who speak Galileans?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how then do we each hear them speaking in our own tongue wherein we were born?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians, Medes, Elamites and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, in Egypt and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cretans and Arabians — we hear them speak in our own tongues the wonderful works of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all amazed and were in doubt, saying one to another, “What meaneth this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others mocking said, “These men are full of new wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice and said unto them, “Ye men of Judea and all ye who dwell in Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these are not drunken as ye suppose, seeing it is but the third hour of the day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out My Spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on My servants and on My handmaidens I will pour out in those days My Spirit, and they shall prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will show wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath — blood and fire and vapor of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood before that great and notable Day of the Lord come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ye men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a Man approved of God among you by miracles, wonders, and signs, which God did through Him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know —
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him, being delivered by the determinate will and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken and by wicked hands have crucified and slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God hath raised Him up, having loosed the pains of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David speaketh concerning Him: ‘I beheld the Lord always before my face, for He is on my right hand, that I should not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt Thou suffer Thine Holy One to see corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; Thou shalt make me full of joy with Thy countenance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men and brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulcher is with us unto this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, being a prophet and knowing that God had sworn an oath to him that from the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh He would raise up Christ to sit on his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David, foreseeing this, spoke concerning the resurrection of Christ that ‘His soul was not left in hell, neither did His flesh see corruption.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Jesus hath God raised up, of which we are all witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, being exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, He hath shed forth this which ye now see and hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David is not ascended into the heavens, but he himself saith, ‘The Lord said unto my Lord, “Sit Thou on My right hand
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make Thy foes Thy footstool.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly that God hath made that same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, “Men and brethren, what shall we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said unto them, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins; and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all who are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, “Save yourselves from this untoward generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those who gladly received his words were baptized, and that same day there were added unto them about three thousand souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they continued steadfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in the breaking of bread and in prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who believed were together and had all things in common,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they sold their possessions and goods and divided them among all men, as every man had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they ate their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple, which is called Beautiful, to ask alms from those who entered into the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He, seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, asked for alms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, “Look on us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “Silver and gold have I none, but such as I have, I give thee: in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took him by the right hand and lifted him up, and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaping up, he stood and walked and entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they knew that it was he that sat for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple; and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as the lame man who had been healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch, which is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, “Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? Or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified His Son Jesus, whom ye delivered up, and denied Him in the presence of Pilate when he was determined to let Him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and killed the Prince of Life whom God hath raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His name, through faith in His name, hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know. Yea, the faith which is by Him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, brethren, I know that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those things which God before had shown by the mouth of all His prophets, that Christ should suffer, He hath thus fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Repent ye therefore and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He shall send Jesus Christ, who before was preached unto you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom Heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all His holy prophets since the world began.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses truly said unto the fathers, ‘A Prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you from your brethren, like unto me; Him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever He shall say unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that every soul who will not hear that Prophet shall be destroyed from among the people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are the children of the prophets and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, ‘And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto you first, God, having raised up His Son Jesus, sent Him to bless you in turning every one of you away from his iniquities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they spoke unto the people, the priests and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees came upon them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being aggrieved that they taught the people and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laid hands on them and put them in hold until the next day, for it was now eventide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, many of those who had heard the Word believed, the number of the men being about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers and elders and scribes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas and John and Alexander, and as many as were kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had set them in their midst, they asked, “By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, “Ye rulers of the people and elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we this day are examined about the good deed done to the infirm man, and by what means he is made whole,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: be it known unto you all and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified and whom God raised from the dead, even by Him doth this man stand here before you whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is ‘the stone which was set at nought by you builders and which has become the head of the corner.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is there salvation in any other, for there is no other name under heaven given among men whereby we must be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled; and they took note concerning them that they had been with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beholding the man who was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they had commanded them to go outside the council, they conferred among themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “What shall we do to these men? For indeed, that a notable miracle hath been done by them is manifest to all those who dwell in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so that it spread no further among the people, let us strictly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called them back and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and John answered and said unto them, “Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing for which they might punish them, because of the people; for all men glorified God for that which had been done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the man was over forty years old on whom this miracle of healing was shown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being let go, they went to their own company and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord and said, “Lord, Thou art God who hast made heaven and earth and the sea and all that is in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who by the mouth of Thy servant David hast said, ‘Why did the heathen rage, and the people imagine vain things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord and against His Christ.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For truly against Thy holy child Jesus, whom Thou hast anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, had gathered together
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to do whatsoever Thy hand and Thy counsel determined before to be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings, and grant unto Thy servants that with all boldness they may speak Thy Word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by stretching forth Thine hand to heal, and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of Thy holy child Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spoke the Word of God with boldness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude of those who believed were of one heart and of one soul; neither said any one of them that any of the things which he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with great power the apostles gave witness to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was upon them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither was there any among them that lacked, for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid them down at the apostles’ feet. And distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joses, who was surnamed by the apostles Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, “the Son of Consolation”), a Levite of the country of Cyprus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having land, sold it and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it, and brought a certain part of it and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost and to keep back part of the price of the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While it remained, was it not thine own? And after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? Why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? Thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and gave up the ghost. And great fear came on all those who heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the young men arose and wrapped him up, and carried him out and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was about the space of three hours later when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said unto her, “Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much?” And she said, “Yea, for so much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said unto her, “How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who have buried thy husband are at the door and shall carry thee out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she fell down straightway at his feet and yielded up the ghost. And the young men came in and found her dead and, carrying her forth, buried her by her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great fear came upon all the church and upon as many as heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people, and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s Porch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of the rest, no man dared join himself to them, but the people magnified them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And more believers were added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets and laid them on beds and couches, that at least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks and those who were vexed with unclean spirits; and they were healed, every one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest rose up and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees); and they were filled with indignation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this Life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard that, they entered into the temple early in the morning and taught. But the high priest came, and those who were with him, and called the council together with all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the officers came and found them not in the prison, they returned and reported, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The prison truly found we shut with all safety and the keepers standing outside before the doors; but when we had opened them, we found no man within.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they were in doubt about them as to where this would grow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there came one and told them, saying, “Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the captain went with his officers and brought them without violence, for they feared the people, lest they should be stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council. And the high priest asked them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Did not we strictly command you that ye should not teach in this name? And behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, “We ought to obey God rather than men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him hath God exalted with His right hand to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are His witnesses of these things, and so is also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to those who obey Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they were cut to the heart and took counsel to slay them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there stood up one in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law held in high repute among all the people, and commanded them to put the apostles outside a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, “Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do concerning these men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before these days Theudas rose up, boasting himself to be somebody, to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves. He was slain, and all who obeyed him were scattered and brought to nought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this man, rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away many people after him. He also perished, and all who obeyed him were dispersed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I say unto you, refrain from these men and let them alone, for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it, lest it may happen ye be found even to fight against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with him they agreed. And when they had called the apostles back and had beaten them, they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And daily in the temple and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them and said, “It is not fitting that we should leave the Word of God to serve tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brethren, look ye out among you for seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer and to the ministry of the Word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude. And they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip and Prochorus and Nicanor, and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom they set before the apostles. And when they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly, and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there arose certain from the synagogue which is called the Synagogue of the Libertines, and Cyrenians and Alexandrians, and those of Cilicia and of Asia, and they disputed with Stephen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they suborned men who said, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes, and came upon him and caught him, and brought him to the council.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they set up false witnesses who said, “This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place and the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who sat on the council, looking steadfastly on him, saw his face as though it were the face of an angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the high priest, “Are these things so?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Stephen said, “Men, brethren and fathers, hearken! The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto him, ‘Get thee out of thy country and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall show thee.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldeans, and dwelt in Haran; and from thence, when his father was dead, He removed himself into this land wherein ye now dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He gave him no inheritance in it — no, not so much as to set his foot on; yet He promised that He would give it to him as a possession and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spoke in this way: that his seed should sojourn in a strange land, and that they should be brought into bondage and be mistreated for four hundred years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge,’ said God, ‘and after that shall they come forth, and serve Me in this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He gave him the covenant of circumcision. And so Abraham begot Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day; and Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot the twelve patriarchs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt. But God was with him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now there came a dearth and great affliction over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and our fathers found no sustenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he first sent out our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the second visit Joseph was made known to his brethren, and Joseph’s kindred were made known unto Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joseph sent and called his father Jacob to him and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jacob went down into Egypt and died, he and our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were carried back into Shechem, and laid in the sepulcher that Abraham had bought for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until another king arose who knew not Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same dealt craftily with our kindred and illtreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end that they might not live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Moses was born and was exceedingly fair, and was nourished in his father’s house three months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up and nourished him as her own son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses became learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And when he was fully forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren, the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, and struck down the Egyptian,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he supposed his brethren would have understood how God, by his hand, would deliver them; but they understood not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day he showed himself unto them as they were quarreling, and would have set them at one again, saying, ‘Sirs, ye are brethren; why do ye wrong one another?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that was doing his neighbor wrong thrust him away, saying, ‘Who made thee a ruler and judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wilt thou kill me as thou didst the Egyptian yesterday?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses fled at this saying and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he begot two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And when forty years had expired, there appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai an angel of the Lord, in a flame of fire in a bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight; and as he drew near to behold it, the voice of the Lord came unto him, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.’ Then Moses trembled and dared not behold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Lord to him, ‘Put off thy shoes from thy feet, for the place where thou standest is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have seen, I have seen the affliction of My people who are in Egypt, and I have heard their groaning and have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send thee into Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This Moses whom they refused, saying, ‘Who made thee a ruler and a judge?’ was the same whom God sent to be a ruler and a deliverer, by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought them out after he had shown wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is that Moses who said unto the children of Israel, ‘A Prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you from your brethren, like unto me; Him shall ye hear.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is he, who in the church in the wilderness was with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers—the one who received the living oracles to give unto us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom our fathers would not be obedient, but thrust him from them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying unto Aaron, ‘Make us gods to go before us; for as for this Moses, who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we know not what has become of him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made a calf in those days and offered sacrifice unto the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then God turned, and gave them up to the worship of the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the Prophets: ‘O ye house of Israel, have ye offered to Me slain beasts and sacrifices for the space of forty years in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god Remphan, images which ye made to worship them. And I will carry you away beyond Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as He had appointed, speaking unto Moses that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which also our fathers, who came later, brought with Joshua into the territory of the Gentiles, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers until the days of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David found favor before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Solomon built Him a house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, the Most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands, as saith the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Heaven is My throne, and earth is My footstool. What house will ye build Me? saith the Lord. Or what is the place of My rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hath not My hand made all these things?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ye stiffnecked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears, ye do always resist the Holy Ghost! As your fathers did, so do ye!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the prophets have your fathers not persecuted? And they have slain those who foretold the coming of the Just One. Of Him ye have now been the betrayers and murderers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not kept it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed with their teeth at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looked up steadfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cast him out of the city and stoned him. And the witnesses laid down their clothes at the feet of a young man whose name was Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stoned Stephen as he called upon God and said, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he kneeled down and cried with a loud voice, “Lord, charge not this sin against them.” And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And devout men carried Stephen to his burial, and made great lamentation over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Saul, he made havoc of the church. Entering into every house and haling men and women, he committed them to prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore those who were scattered abroad went everywhere preaching the Word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spoke, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, came out of many who were possessed with them; and many taken with palsies and who were lame, were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was great joy in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there was a certain man called Simon, who earlier in the same city had used sorcery and bewitched the people of Samaria, claiming that he was someone great,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom they all gave heed from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is great with the power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for him they had regard, because for a long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they believed Philip’s preaching of the things concerning the Kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon himself believed also; and when he was baptized he continued with Philip and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that amaria had received the Word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when they had come down, prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For as yet, He had fallen upon none of them, for they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said unto him, “Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter, for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God that perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon answered and said, “Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they, when they had testified and preached the Word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem and preached the Gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the Lord spoke unto Philip, saying, “Arise and go toward the south unto the road that goeth down from Jerusalem into Gaza, which is desert.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he arose and went. And behold, a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who had charge of all her treasure and had come to Jerusalem to worship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: was returning; and sitting in his chariot, he was reading Isaiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, “Go near and join thyself to this chariot.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Philip ran thither to him, and heard him reading the prophet Isaiah, and said, “Understandest thou what thou readest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “How can I, unless some man should guide me?” And he besought Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The place of the Scripture from which he read was this: “He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb before his shearer is dumb, so opened He not His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In His humiliation, His judgment was taken away. And who shall declare His generation? For His life is taken from the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the eunuch answered Philip and said, “I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? Of himself, or of some other man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Philip opened his mouth and began at the same Scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water; and the eunuch said, “See, here is water! What doth hinder me from being baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Philip said, “If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest.” And he answered and said, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still, and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip. And the eunuch saw him no more, and went on his way rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Philip was found at Azotus, and passing through, he preached in all the cities until he came to Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked of him letters to the synagogues at Damascus, that if he found any who were of this Way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he journeyed he came near Damascus, and suddenly there shone round about him a light from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he fell to the earth and heard a voice saying unto him, “Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Who art Thou, Lord?” And the Lord said, “I am Jesus whom thou persecutest; it is hard for thee to kick against the goads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he, trembling and astonished, said, “Lord, what wilt Thou have me to do?” And the Lord said unto him, “Arise and go into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men who journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice but seeing no man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul arose from the earth, and when his eyes were opened, he could see no man; but they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was three days without sight, and neither did he eat nor drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias. And the Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias.” And he said, “Behold, I am here, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said unto him, “Arise and go into the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judas for the one called Saul of Tarsus; for behold, he prayeth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him, that he might receive his sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many of this man, and how much evil he hath done to Thy saints in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on Thy name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said unto him, “Go thy way, for he is a chosen vessel unto Me, to bear My name before the Gentiles and kings and the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will show him what great things he must suffer for My name’s sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Ananias went his way and entered into the house, and putting his hands on him said, “Brother Saul, the Lord, even Jesus who appeared unto thee on the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight and be filled with the Holy Ghost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately there fell from his eyes something like scales, and he received sight forthwith, and arose and was baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was Saul certain days with the disciples who were at Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that He is the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all that heard him were amazed and said, “Is not this he that destroyed those who called on this name in Jerusalem, and came hither with the intent that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul increased the more in strength and confounded the Jews who dwelt in Damascus, proving that Jesus is the very Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their lying in wait became known to Saul. And they watched the gates day and night to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples took him by night, and let him down through the wall in a basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Saul had come to Jerusalem, he attempted to join himself to the disciples, but they were all afraid of him and believed not that he was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles, and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord on the way and that He had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was with them, coming in and going out at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus and disputed against the Grecians, but they went about to slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the brethren heard of this, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him forth to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the churches throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had rest and were edified, and, walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, as Peter was passing throughout all quarters, he came down also to the saints who dwelt at Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had kept to his bed for eight years and was sick with the palsy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said unto him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed.” And he arose immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who dwelt in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha (which interpreted is called Dorcas). This woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in those days that she was sick and died; and when they had washed her, they laid her in an upper chamber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And inasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring him that he should not delay to come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter arose and went with them. And when he had come, they brought him into the upper chamber; and all the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the coats and garments which Dorcas made while she was with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter put them all outside and kneeled down and prayed, and turning to the body, he said, “Tabitha, arise.” And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter she sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave her his hand and lifted her up; and calling in the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon, a tanner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the band called the Italian Band,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a devout man and one who feared God with all his house, who gave many alms to the people and prayed to God always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw in a vision clearly, about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God coming in to him and saying unto him, “Cornelius!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he looked on him, he was afraid and said, “What is it, lord?” And he said unto him, “Thy prayers and thine alms have risen up as a memorial before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now send men to Joppa and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lodgeth with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the seaside; he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the angel who spoke unto Cornelius had departed, he called two of his household servants and a devout soldier from those who waited on him continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had related all these things unto them, he sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the morrow, as they went on their journey and drew nigh unto the city, Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he became very hungry and would have eaten; but while they were making ready he fell into a trance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw heaven opened and a certain vessel descending unto him as though it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners and let down to the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherein were all kinds of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts and creeping things and fowls of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came a voice to him, “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Not so, Lord, for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the voice spoke unto him again the second time, “What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was done thrice, and the vessel was received up again into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Peter wondered to himself what this vision which he had seen could mean, behold, the men who had been sent from Cornelius had made inquiry for Simon’s house and stood before the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and called and asked whether Simon, who was surnamed Peter, was lodged there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, “Behold, three men seek thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arise therefore, and get thee down and go with them, doubting nothing, for I have sent them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter went down to the men who were sent unto him from Cornelius and said, “Behold, I am he whom ye seek. What is the cause for which ye have come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Cornelius the centurion, a just man and one who feareth God, and of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by a holy angel to send for thee into his house and to hear words from thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter called them in and lodged them. And on the morrow Peter went away with them, and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea. And Cornelius waited for them, and had called together his kinsmen and near friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter took him up, saying, “Stand up; I myself also am a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he talked with him, he went in and found many who had come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, “Ye know that it is an unlawful thing for a man who is a Jew to keep company with or to come unto one of another nation. But God hath shown me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying as soon as I was sent for. I ask therefore, with what intent ye have sent for me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Cornelius said, “Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms have been remembered in the sight of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send therefore to Joppa and call hither Simon, whose surname is Peter. He is lodged in the house of one Simon, a tanner, by the seaside. He, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately therefore I sent to thee, and thou hast done well, that thou hast come. Now therefore are we all here present before God to hear all things that are commanded thee from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter opened his mouth and said, “In truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in every nation he that feareth Him and worketh righteousness is accepted by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word which God sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ (He is Lord of all) —
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Word, I say, ye know, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, and began from Galilee after the baptism which John preached:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power, and how He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are witnesses of all things which He did, both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem — He whom they hanged on a tree and slew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him God raised up the third day and showed Him openly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before by God, even to us who ate and drank with Him after He rose from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is He who was ordained by God to be the Judge of the quick and dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Him all the prophets bear witness, that through His name whosoever believeth in Him shall receive remission of sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was yet speaking these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all those who heard the Word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those of the Circumcision who believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Ghost was poured out also on the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they heard them speak with tongues and magnify God. Then answered Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized who have received the Holy Ghost, as well as we?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then they entreated him to tarry certain days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles and the brethren who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter had come up to Jerusalem, those who were of the Circumcision contended with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Thou wentest in to uncircumcised men and didst eat with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter reviewed the matter from the beginning and expounded it in order unto them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision. A certain vessel descended as though it had been a great sheet let down from heaven by four corners, and it came even to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I had fastened my eyes on it, I considered it and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things and fowls of the air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I heard a voice saying unto me, ‘Arise, Peter; slay and eat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said, ‘Not so, Lord, for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the voice answered me again from heaven, ‘What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, immediately three men had already come unto the house where I was, sent from Caesarea unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit bade me go with them, doubting nothing. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he showed us how he had seen an angel in his house, who stood and said unto him, ‘Send men to Joppa and call for Simon, whose surname is Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall tell thee words whereby thou and all of thy house shall be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I began to speak, the Holy Ghost fell on them, as on us at the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how He had said, ‘John indeed baptized with water, but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If therefore God gave them the same gift as He did unto us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could withstand God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, “Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who had been scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose on account of Stephen, traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, preaching the Word to none but unto the Jews only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke unto the Greeks, preaching the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem, and they sent forth Barnabas, that he should go as far as Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came and had seen the grace of God, he was glad and exhorted them all that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he was a good man and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith. And many people were added unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Barnabas departed to Tarsus to seek out Saul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he had found him, he brought him unto Antioch. And it came to pass that for a whole year they assembled themselves with the church, and taught many people. And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them named Agabus stood up, and signified by the Spirit that there would be a great dearth throughout all the world, which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples, every man according to his ability, determined to send relief unto the brethren who dwelt in Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to vex certain of the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (This was during the Days of Unleavened Bread.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had apprehended him, he put him in prison and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to guard him, intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter therefore was kept in prison, but prayer was made without ceasing by the church unto God for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod would have brought him forth, that same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains; and the keepers were guarding the door of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the angel of the Lord came upon him, and a light shined in the prison; and he smote Peter on the side and raised him up, saying, “Arise up quickly.” And his chains fell off from his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said unto him, “Gird thyself and bind on thy sandals.” And so he did. And the angel said unto him, “Cast thy garment about thee and follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out and followed him, and knew not whether what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had passed the first and the second guard, they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city, which opened to them of his own accord. And they went out and passed on through one street, and forthwith the angel departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter had come to himself, he said, “Now I know in truth that the Lord hath sent His angel, and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod and from all the expectations of the people of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had considered this thing, he went to the house of Mary the mother of John, whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel named Rhoda came to ask who was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she recognized Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in and told how Peter stood before the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto her, “Thou art mad.” But she continued to affirm that it was even so. Then they said, “It is his angel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter continued knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, beckoning unto them with his hand to hold their peace, declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, “Go and tell these things unto James and to the brethren.” And he departed and went into another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers over what had become of Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod had sought him and found him not, he examined the guards and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judea to Caesarea and there stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Herod was highly displeased with those from Tyre and Sidon. But they came with one accord to him and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, they asked for peace, because their country was nourished by the king’s country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne and delivered an oration unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people gave a shout, saying, “It is the voice of a god, and not of a man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory; and he was eaten by worms and gave up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Word of God grew and multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem when they had fulfilled their ministry, and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were in the church at Antioch certain prophets and teachers: Barnabas, and Simeon who was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene,and Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they ministered to the Lord and fasted, the Holy Ghost said, “Set apart for Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they, being sent forth by the Holy Ghost, departed unto Seleucia, and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were at Salamis, they preached the Word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had also John in their ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was with the deputy of the country, Sergius Paulus, a prudent man who called for Barnabas and Saul, and desired to hear the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul (who also is called Paul), filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “O, full of all guile and all mischief, thou child of the devil, thou enemy of all righteousness, wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season.” And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness, and he went about seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Paul and his company cast loose from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia; and John, departing from them, returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them, saying, “Ye men and brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said: “Men of Israel and ye that fear God, give audience!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with uplifted arm He brought them out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for about forty years, He suffered their ways in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He divided their land among them by lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after that, He gave unto them judges for about the space of four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward they desired a king, and God gave unto them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for the space of forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had removed him, He raised up unto them David to be their king, to whom also He gave testimony and said, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after Mine own heart, who shall fulfill all My will.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of this man’s seed hath God, according to His promise, raised unto Israel a Savior, Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John had first preached, before His coming, the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as John was fulfilling his course, he said, ‘Whom think ye that I am? I am not He. But behold, there cometh One after me, the shoes of whose feet I am not worthy to loose.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men and brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you feareth God, to you is the word of this salvation sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who dwell in Jerusalem and their rulers, because they knew Him not nor yet understood the voices of the Prophets which are read every Sabbath day, have fulfilled them in condemning Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though they found no cause for death in Him, yet they asked Pilate that He should be slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of Him, they took Him down from the tree and laid Him in a sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised Him from the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He was seen many days by those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are His witnesses unto the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we declare unto you glad tidings of the promise which was made unto the fathers:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children, in that He hath raised up Jesus again, as it is also written in the second Psalm: ‘Thou art My Son; this day have I begotten Thee.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And concerning that He raised Him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, He said thus: ‘I will give you the sure mercies of David.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore He saith also in another Psalm: ‘Thou shalt not suffer Thine Holy One to see corruption.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers, and saw corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He whom God raised again saw no corruption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be it known unto you therefore, men and brethren, that through this Man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by Him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the Law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you which is spoken of in the Prophets:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, ye despisers, and wonder and perish; for I work a work your days, a work in which you shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Jews had gone out of the synagogue, the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the congregation had broken up, many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next Sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes they were filled with envy, and spoke against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.
verses.speaker: Narrator
