verses.text: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold and said, “It was necessary that the Word of God should first have been spoken to you. But seeing ye put it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, lo, we turn to the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For so hath the Lord commanded us, saying, ‘I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles, that thou shouldest bring salvation unto the ends of the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and glorified the Word of the Lord; and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Word of the Lord was spread abroad throughout all the region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honorable women and the chief men of the city, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out of their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass in Iconium that together they both went into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude of both the Jews and also of the Greeks believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and planted evil in their minds against the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A long time therefore they tarried among them, speaking boldly in the Lord, which gave testimony unto the word of His grace, and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the multitude of the city was divided, and part held with the Jews and part with the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when there was an assault made both by the Gentiles and also the Jews, with their rulers, to use them spitefully and to stone them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were aware of it and fled unto Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there they preached the Gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there sat at Lystra a certain man, impotent in his feet, being a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This same one heard Paul speak who, steadfastly beholding him and perceiving that he had faith to be healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on thy feet!” And he leaped and walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in the language of Lycaonia, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter, and Paul, Mercury, because he was the chief speaker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest of Jupiter, who was in front of the city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates and would have done sacrifice along with the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of this, they rent their clothes and ran in among the people, crying out and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sirs, why do ye these things? We also are men of like passions as you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God, who made heaven and earth and the sea, and all things that are therein,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, He left not Himself without witness, in that He did good, and gave us rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even with these sayings they scarcely restrained the people from doing sacrifice unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium who persuaded the people; and having stoned Paul, they dragged him out of the city, supposing he was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up and came into the city; and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had preached the Gospel to that city and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra and to Iconium and Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: confirming the souls of the disciples and exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that we must through much tribulation enter into the Kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had ordained elders in every church and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord in whom they believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had preached the Word in Perga, they went down into Attalia
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thence sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been commended to the grace of God for the work which they had fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come and had gathered the church together, they recounted all that God had done with them, and how He had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there they remained a long time with the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain men who came down from Judea taught the brethren and said, “Unless ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas and certain others of them should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being sent on their way by the church, they passed through Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles; and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come to Jerusalem, they were received by the church and by the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees who believed, saying that it was needful to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the Law of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the apostles and the elders came together to consider this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up and said unto them, “Men and brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the Word of the Gospel and believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God, who knoweth the hearts, bore them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost even as He did unto us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore why tempt ye God to put a yoke upon the necks of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul as they declared what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, “Men and brethren, hearken unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon hath declared how God at the first visited the Gentiles to take out from them a people for His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to this agree the words of the Prophets, as it is written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which has fallen down. And I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles upon whom My name is called, saith the Lord who doeth all these things.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Known unto God are all His works from the beginning of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore my judgment is that we trouble not those from among the Gentiles who are turned to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but that we write unto them that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and from fornication, and from things strangled, and from blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses from olden times hath in every city those who preach him, he being read in the synagogues every Sabbath day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it pleased the apostles and elders, together with the whole church, to send men chosen from their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas, namely Judas surnamed Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they wrote letters to accompany them in this manner: “The apostles and elders and brethren send greetings unto the brethren who are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inasmuch as we have heard that certain ones who went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, ‘Ye must be circumcised and keep the law’ — to whom we gave no such commandment —
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men who have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell you the same things by mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication. If ye keep yourselves from these things, ye shall do well. Fare ye well!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they were sent off, they went to Antioch. And when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they had read it, they rejoiced in its consolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and strengthened them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had tarried there a space, they were let go in peace by the brethren to return unto the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, it pleased Silas to remain there still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the Word of the Lord, with many others also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some days later, Paul said unto Barnabas, “Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the Word of the Lord, and see how they do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul thought it not good to take him with them, as he had departed from them in Pamphylia, and had not gone with them in the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the contention was so sharp between them that they parted asunder, one from the other; and so Barnabas took Mark and sailed to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul chose Silas and departed, being commended by the brethren unto the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul came to Derbe and Lystra. And behold, a certain disciple was there named Timothy, the son of a certain woman who was a Jewess who believed, but whose father was a Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was well reported of by the brethren who were at Lystra and Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him Paul wanted to have go forth with him, and took and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those quarters, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went through the cities, they delivered unto them the decrees to keep, that had been ordained by the apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Ghost to preach the Word in Asia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had come to Mysia, they attempted to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit suffered permit not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night: there stood a man of Macedonia beseeching him, saying, “Come over into Macedonia and help us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had seen the vision, immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia, assuredly concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the Gospel unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore casting loose from Troas we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the next day Neapolis,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia, and a colony. And we stayed in that city a number of days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the Sabbath, we went out of the city by a riverside where prayer was wont to be made; and we sat down and spoke unto the women who resorted thither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, who worshiped God, heard us; and the Lord opened her heart to give heed unto the things which were spoken by Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she was baptized with her household, she besought us, saying, “If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house and abide there.” And she constrained us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed by a spirit of divination met us. She had brought her masters much gain by soothsaying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same followed Paul and us, crying out and saying, “These men are the servants of the Most High God, who show unto us the way of salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this she did many days. But Paul, being grieved, turned and said to the spirit, “I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her.” And he came out that same hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone, they caught Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace unto the rulers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought them to the magistrates, saying, “These men, being Jews, trouble our city exceedingly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and teach customs which are not lawful for us to receive nor to observe, being Romans.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the multitude rose up together against them, and the magistrates rent off their clothes and commanded that they be beaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailer to keep them safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison and made their feet fast in the stocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed and sang praises unto God, and the prisoners heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s bands were loosed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the keeper of the prison, awakening out of his sleep and seeing the prison doors open, drew out his sword and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Do thyself no harm, for we are all here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling and fell down before Paul and Silas,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought them out and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spoke unto him the Word of the Lord, and to all who were in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took them that same hour of the night and washed their stripes, and was baptized, he and all his, straightway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them and rejoiced, believing in God with all his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the sergeants, saying, “Let those men go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the keeper of the prison told these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent to let you go; now therefore depart and go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said unto them, “They have beaten us openly, uncondemned, being Romans, and have cast us into prison. And now do they thrust us out privily? Nay verily! Let them come themselves and fetch us out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sergeants told these words unto the magistrates, and they feared when they heard that they were Romans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came and besought them and brought them out, and entreated them to depart out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went out of the prison and entered into the house of Lydia. And when they had seen the brethren, they comforted them and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica where there was a synagogue of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul, as was his custom, went in unto them, and for three Sabbath days reasoned with them from the Scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: expounding and alleging that it was necessary for Christ to have suffered and risen again from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus whom I preach unto you is Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them believed, and joined themselves with Paul and Silas, as did a great multitude of the devout Greeks, and of the chief women not a few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews who believed not, moved with envy, engaged certain wicked fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a crowd and set all the city in an uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason and sought to bring them out to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they found them not, they dragged Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, “These that have turned the world upside down have come hither also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jason hath received them; and they all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, one Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city when they heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had taken security from Jason and the others, they let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea, who arriving there, went into the synagogue of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the Word with allreadiness of mind and searched the Scriptures daily to see whether those things were so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore many of them believed, also honorable women who were Greeks, and of men not a few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica became aware that the Word of God was preached by Paul at Berea, they came there also and stirred up the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go down to the sea, but Silas and Timothy remained there still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who conducted Paul brought him unto Athens and, having received direction for Silas and Timothy to come to him with all speed, they departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred within him when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he disputed in the synagogue with the Jews, and with the devout persons, and in the marketplace daily with those who met with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans and of the Stoics encountered him. And some said, “What will this babbler say?” And some others said, “He seemeth to be a proclaimer of strange gods,” because he preached unto them Jesus and the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took him and brought him unto the Areopagus, saying, “May we know what this new doctrine is whereof thou speakest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears, and we would know therefore what these things mean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For all the Athenians and strangers who were there spent their time in nothing else than either telling or hearing some new thing.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars’ Hill and said, “Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as I passed by and beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription: ‘To the Unknown God’. Whom therefore ye worship in ignorance, Him I declare unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God who made the world and all things therein, seeing that He is Lord of Heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither is He worshiped with men’s hands, as though He needed anything, seeing He giveth to all life, and breath, and all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He hath made of one blood all nations of men to dwell on all the face of the earth, and hath determined the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they should seek the Lord, if perhaps they might feel after Him and find Him, though He be not far from every one of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Him we live, and move, and have our being; as also certain of your own poets have said, ‘For we are also His offspring.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For inasmuch, then, as we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold or silver or stone, graven by art and of man’s devising.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The times of this ignorance God overlooked, but now He commandeth all men everywhere to repent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because He hath appointed a Day in which He will judge the world in righteousness by that Man whom He hath ordained. Of this He hath given assurance unto all men, in that He hath raised Him from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked and others said, “We will hear thee again on this matter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul departed from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, certain men cleaved unto him and believed, among whom were Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, Paul departed from Athens and came to Corinth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There he found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus and lately come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome. Paul went unto them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because he was of the same craft, he lodged with them and worked; for by their occupation they were tentmakers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Silas and Timothy had come from Macedonia, Paul was pressed in the spirit, and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they opposed themselves and blasphemed, he shook his raiment and said unto them, “Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean. From henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he departed thence and entered into a certain man’s house named Justus, one who worshiped God and whose house was adjoining the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord, with all his house. And many of the Corinthians, hearing, believed and were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Paul in the night through a vision, saying, “Be not afraid, but speak and hold not thy peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am with thee, and no man shall set upon thee to hurt thee, for I have many people in this city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he continued there a year and six months, teaching the Word of God among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Gallio was deputy of Achaia, the Jews with one accord began an insurrection against Paul, and brought him to the judgment seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said unto the Jews, “If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness, O ye Jews, reason would have it that I should bear with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it be a question of words and names and your own law, look ye to it; for I will not be judge of such matters.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he drove them from the judgment seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the chief ruler of the synagogue, and beat him in front of the judgment seat. But Gallio was concerned about none of those things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while, and then took his leave of the brethren and sailed thence into Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila, having shorn his head at Cenchrea, for he had made a vow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to Ephesus and left them there, but he himself entered into the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they desired him to tarry a longer time with them, he consented not,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but bade them farewell, saying, “I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem, but I will return again unto you, if God wills.” And he sailed from Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had landed at Caesarea and had gone up and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had spent some time there, he departed and went through all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man and mighty in the Scriptures, came to Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man was instructed in the Way of the Lord; and being fervent in the Spirit, he spoke and taught diligently the things of the Lord, though he knew only the baptism of John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Aquila and Priscilla had heard him, they took him unto them and expounded unto him the Way of God more perfectly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him. And when he had come, he helped them much who had believed through grace;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he mightily refuted the Jews (and that publicly), showing by the Scriptures that Jesus was Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul, having passed through the upper regions, came to Ephesus; and finding certain disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said unto them, “Have ye received the Holy Ghost, having believed?” And they said unto him, “We have not so much as heard whether there is any Holy Ghost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, “Unto what then were ye baptized?” And they said, “Unto John’s baptism.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul, “John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people that they should believe in Him who should come after him, that is, in Christ Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came upon them, and they spoke with tongues and prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were about twelve men in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went into the synagogue and spoke boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading about the things concerning the Kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when divers ones were hardened and believed not, but spoke evil of that Way before the multitude, he departed from them and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this continued for the space of two years, so that all who dwelt in Asia heard the Word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that handkerchiefs or aprons from his body were brought unto the sick, and the diseases departed from them and the evil spirits went out of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took it upon themselves to pronounce the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits, saying, “We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew and chief of the priests, who did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the evil spirit answered and said, “Jesus I know, and Paul I know, but who are ye?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man in whom the evil spirit dwelt leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this became known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling in Ephesus, and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many who believed came, and confessed, and showed their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of those also who used occult arts brought their books together and burned them before all men; and they counted up the price of them, and found it to be fifty thousand pieces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Word of God grew mightily and prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the Spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent into Macedonia two of those who had ministered unto him, Timothy and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the same time, there arose no small stir about that Way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith who made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, “Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, ye see and hear that, not alone at Ephesus but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away many people, saying that they are not gods which are made with hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that not only this our craft is in danger of being set at nought, but also the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshipeth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard these things, they were full of wrath and cried out, saying, “Great is Diana of the Ephesians!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole city was filled with confusion and, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia who were Paul’s companions in his travel, they rushed with one accord into the theater.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the Asian chiefs, who were his friends, sent unto him, urging that he would not venture into the theater.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some therefore cried one thing and some another, for the assembly was in confusion, and the greater part knew not why they had come together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they drew Alexander out from the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with his hand, and would have made his defense unto the people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they perceived that he was a Jew, all with one voice for about the space of two hours cried out, “Great is Diana of the Ephesians!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the town clerk had appeased the people, he said, “Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there who knoweth not that the city of the Ephesians is a worshiper of the great goddess Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet and do nothing rashly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for ye have brought hither these men who are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against any man, the law is open and there are deputies. Let them implead one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye inquire of anything concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are in danger of being called in question for this day’s uproar, there being no cause whereby we can give an account of this concourse.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the uproar had ceased, Paul called unto him the disciples, and embraced them, and departed to go into Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had gone through those parts and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there he abode three months. And when the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail for Syria, he purposed to return through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there accompanied him into Asia, Sopater of Berea, and Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians, and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy; and from Asia, Tychichus and Trophimus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These, going ahead, tarried for us at Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the Days of Unleavened Bread and came unto them in five days at Troas, where we stayed seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them, ready to depart on the morrow, and continued his speech until midnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber where they were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, having fallen into a deep sleep; and as Paul was long in preaching, he sank down with sleep and fell down from the third floor and was taken up dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul went down and fell on him and, embracing him, said, “Trouble not yourselves, for his life is in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he therefore had come up again, and had broken bread and eaten and talked for a long while, even until break of day, he departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we went ahead to the ship and sailed for Assos, there intending to take aboard Paul; for so had he arranged, intending himself to go on foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him on board and came to Mitylene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we sailed thence and arrived the next day off Chios; and the next day we arrived at Samos and tarried at Trogyllium; and the next day we came to Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Paul had determined to sail past Ephesus, because he would not spend the time in Asia; for he was in haste, that it might be possible for him to be at Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called for the elders of the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had come to him, he said unto them, “Ye know, from the first day that I came into Asia, in what manner I have been with you in all seasons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: serving the Lord in all humility of mind, and with many tears and temptations which befell me through the lying in wait of the Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how I kept back nothing that was profitable for you, but have shown you and have taught you publicly and from house to house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: testifying both to the Jews and also to the Greeks repentance toward God and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now behold, bound by the Spirit, I go unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions await me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But none of these things move me, neither count I my life dear unto myself, so that I might finish my course with joy, and the ministry which I have received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the Gospel of the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone preaching the Kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I attest to you this day that I am pure from the blood of all men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not shrunk from declaring unto you all the counsel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take heed therefore unto yourselves and to all the flock, over which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church of God which He hath purchased with His own blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know this: that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also from among your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things to draw away disciples after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore watch, and remember that for the space of three years I ceased not to warn everyone night and day with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, brethren, I commend you to God and to the word of His grace, which is able to build you up and to give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have coveted no man’s silver or gold or apparel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, ye yourselves know that these hands have ministered unto my own necessities, and also to those who were with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have shown you all things, how that by so laboring ye ought to support the weak and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how He said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down and prayed with them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they all wept sorely and fell on Paul’s neck and kissed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sorrowing most of all because of the words which he had spoken, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that after we had parted from them and had launched, we came on a straight course unto Coos, and the day following unto Rhodes, and from thence unto Patara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phoenicia, we went aboard and set forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when we had sighted Cyprus, we left it on the left hand, and sailed to Syria and landed at Tyre, for there the ship was to unload her burden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having found disciples, we tarried there seven days. They told Paul through the Spirit that he should not go up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when those days there had been accomplished, we departed and went our way; and they all brought us on our way, with wives and children, until we were out of the city. And we kneeled down on the shore and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we boarded ship, and they returned home again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais and saluted the brethren, and stayed with them one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, we who were in Paul’s company departed and came unto Caesarea, and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and lodged with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this man had four daughters, virgins, who prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as we tarried there many days, there came down from Judea a certain prophet named Agabus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had come unto us, he took Paul’s girdle and bound his own hands and feet, and said, “Thus saith the Holy Ghost, ‘So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owneth this girdle, and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we heard these things, both we and those at that place besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul answered, “What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? For I am not only ready to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he would not be dissuaded, we ceased, saying, “The will of the Lord be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after those days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea, who brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus, an old disciple, with whom we were to lodge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the day following, Paul went with us unto James, and all the elders were present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard it, they glorified the Lord and said unto him, “Thou seest, brother, how many thousands of Jews there are who believe, and they are all zealous for the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they are informed about thee, that thou teachest all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise their children, nor walk according to the customs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is therefore to be done? The multitude must surely come together, for they will hear that thou art come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do therefore this which we say to thee: We have four men who have taken a vow upon themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take them and purify thyself with them, and bear their charges with them, that they may shave their heads; and all may know that those things of which they have been informed concerning thee are nothing, butthat thou thyself also walkest orderly and keepest the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as to the Gentiles who believe, we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing, save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purifying himself with them, he entered into the temple to signify the accomplishment of the days of purification, until an offering should be offered for every one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews who were from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people and laid hands on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: crying out, “Men of Israel, help! This is the man who teacheth all men everywhere against the people and the law and this place, and furthermore brought Greeks also into the temple, and hath polluted this holy place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For they had seen previously with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the city was moved and the people ran together, and they took Paul and dragged him out of the temple; and forthwith the doors were shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the garrison that all Jerusalem was in an uproar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who immediately took soldiers and centurions and ran down unto them; and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left off beating Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief captain came near, and took him and commanded that he be bound with two chains, and demanded who he was and what he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude. And when he could learn nothing with certainty because of the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul came upon the stairs, so it was that he had to be borne by the soldiers because of the violence of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, “Away with him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Paul was about to be led into the castle, he said unto the chief captain, “May I speak unto thee?” And he said, “Canst thou speak Greek?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art not thou that Egyptian who prior to these days madest an uproar and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men who were murderers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am a man who am a Jew of Tarsus, a city of Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city; and I beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had given him leave, Paul stood on the stairs and beckoned with his hand unto the people. And when there fell a great silence, he spoke unto them in the Hebrew tongue, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defense which I make now unto you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (And when they heard that he spoke in the Hebrew tongue to them, they were the more silent.) And he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am verily a man who am a Jew, born in Tarsus, a city of Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, and taughtaccording to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I persecuted this Way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as also the high priest doth bear me witness and all the council of the elders. From them I also received letters unto the brethren, and I went to Damascus to bring those who were there bound unto Jerusalem to be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it came to pass that, as I made my journey and had come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I fell unto the ground and heard a voice saying unto me, ‘Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou Me?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I answered, ‘Who art Thou, Lord?’ And He said unto me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were with me saw indeed the light and were afraid, but they heard not the voice of Him that spoke to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ And the Lord said unto me, ‘Arise and go into Damascus, and there it shall be told thee of all the things which are appointed for thee to do.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, of good report among all the Jews who dwelt there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came unto me and stood and said unto me, ‘Brother Saul, receive thy sight!’ And that same hour I looked up upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘The God of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know His will and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou shalt be His witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now why tarriest thou? Arise and be baptized and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it came to pass that when I had come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw Him saying unto me, ‘Make haste and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem, for they will not receive thy testimony concerning Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in Thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the blood of Thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by and consenting unto his death and kept the raiment of those who slew him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto me, ‘Depart, for I will send thee far hence, unto the Gentiles.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowd gave him an audience up to this word; and then they lifted up their voices and said, “Away with such a fellow from the earth, for it is not fit that he should live!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they cried out and cast off their clothes and threw dust into the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging, so that he might find out why they cried so against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion who stood by, “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman and uncondemned?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion heard this, he went and told the chief captain, saying, “Take heed what thou doest, for this man is a Roman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief captain came and said unto him, “Tell me, art thou a Roman?” And he said, “Yea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief captain answered, “With a great sum I obtained this freedom.” And Paul said, “But I was free born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then straightway those who should have examined him departed from him, and the chief captain also was afraid after he found out that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the morrow, because he would know with certainty why he was accused by the Jews, he loosed him from his bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down and set him before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul, earnestly beholding the council, said, “Men and brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God to this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high priest Ananias commanded those who stood by him to smite him on the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul unto him, “God shall smite thee, thou whited wall! For sittest thou to judge me according to the law, and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who stood by said, “Revilest thou God’s high priest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul, “I knew not, brethren, that he was the high priest; for it is written: ‘Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul perceived that one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out to the council, “Men and brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee: for the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called into question!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees, and the multitude was divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there arose a great cry, and the scribes who were on the Pharisees’ side arose and strove, saying, “We find no evil in this man; but if a spirit or angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should be torn to pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and to take him by force from among them, and to bring him into the castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that night the Lord stood by him and said, “Be of good cheer, Paul; for as thou hast testified for Me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was day, certain of the Jews banded together and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were more than forty who entered into this conspiracy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to the chief priests and elders and said, “We have bound ourselves under a great curse, that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, ye, of the council, ask the chief captain that he bring him down unto you tomorrow, as though ye would inquire somewhat more thoroughly concerning him; and we, even before he comes near, are ready to kill him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul’s sister’s son heard of their lying in wait, he went and entered into the castle and told Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him and said, “Bring this young man unto the chief captain, for he hath a certain thing to tell him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he took him and brought him to the chief captain and said, “Paul, the prisoner, called me unto him and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee, as he hath something to say unto thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and going aside with him privately, asked him, “What is it that thou hast to tell me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “The Jews have agreed to request thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul tomorrow into the council, as though they wished to inquire of him somewhat more thoroughly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do not thou yield unto them, for there lie in wait for him more than forty of their men, who have bound themselves with an oath that they will neither eat nor drink until they have killed him. And now they are ready, looking for consent from thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart and charged him, “See thou tell no man that thou hast revealed these things to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called unto him two centurions, saying, “Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea, and threescore and ten horsemen, and two hundred spearmen, at the third hour of the night;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and provide them with beasts that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he wrote a letter in this manner:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Claudius Lysias, unto the most excellent governor Felix, sendeth greeting:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man was taken by the Jews, and was about to be killed by them. Then came I with an army and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And desiring to know the cause whereof they accused him, I brought him forth into their council.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I perceived him to be accused about questions of their law, but there was nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was told me how the Jews lay in wait for the man, I sent him straightway to thee, and gave a command to his accusers also to speak before thee what they have against him. Farewell.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers took Paul, as it was commanded them, and brought him by night to Antipatris.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him and returned to the castle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when they had come to Caesarea and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the governor had read the letter, he asked of what province Paul was. And when he understood that he was from Cilicia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said, “I will hear thee when thine accusers have also come.” And he commanded him to be kept in Herod’s judgment hall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders and with him a certain orator named Tertullus, who informed the governor against Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, “Seeing that by thee we enjoy much quietness, most noble Felix, and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we accept it always and in all places with all thankfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear from us in thy clemency a few words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also hath gone about profaning the temple. Him we took and would have judged according to our law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and with great violence took him away out of our hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: commanding his accusers to come unto thee, so that by examining him thyself, thou mayest have knowledge of all of these things whereof we accuse him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul, after the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered: “Inasmuch as I know that thou hast been for many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thou mayest understand that there have been yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither stirring up the people, neither in the synagogues nor in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this I confess unto thee, that according to the Way, which they call heresy, so I worship the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the Law and in the Prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have hope in God, which they themselves also hold, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And herein do I exercise myself to have always a conscience void of offense toward God and toward men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, and offerings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, with neither crowd nor tumult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These ought to have been here before thee to object if they had aught against me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or else let these same say here if they have found any evildoing in me when I stood before the council,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unless it be for this one utterance that I cried out standing among them: ‘Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am called into question by you this day.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Felix heard these things, having a more complete knowledge of that Way, he deferred the hearing and said, “When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul, but to let him have some liberties, and that he should forbid none of his acquaintances to minister or come unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after some days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, who was a Jew, he sent for Paul and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Paul reasoned about righteousness, temperance, and the Judgment to come, Felix trembled and answered, “Go thy way for this time. When I have a convenient occasion I will call for thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hoped also that money would be given him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore he sent for him the oftener and communed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix’s position; and Felix, wanting to show the Jews a favor, left Paul bound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Festus had come into the province, after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest and the chief men of the Jews informed him against Paul and besought him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: desiring a favor against him: that he would have Paul brought to Jerusalem, so that they might lie in wait on the way to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Festus answered that Paul should be kept at Caesarea, and that he himself would depart shortly thither.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let those therefore,” he said, “who among you are able, go down with me and accuse this man, if there be any wickedness in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days, he went down unto Caesarea. And the next day, sitting in the judgment seat, he commanded Paul to be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had come, the Jews who came down from Jerusalem stood round about and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul, which they could not prove,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while Paul answered for himself: “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor yet against Caesar have I offended any thing at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Festus, desiring to do the Jews a favor, answered Paul and said, “Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem and there be judged of these things before me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Paul, “I stand at Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be judged. To the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I am an offender, or have committed anything worthy of death, I should not refuse to die; but if there is nothing to these things whereof they accuse me, no man may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, “Hast thou appealed unto Caesar? Unto Caesar shalt thou go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some days later, King Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul’s cause unto the king, saying, “There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: about whom, when I was in Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, desiring to have judgment against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them I answered, ’It is not in the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die before he that is accused has the accusers face to face, and has license to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when they had come hither, without any delay on the morrow, I sat on the judgment seat and commanded the man to be brought forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: against whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no accusation of such things as I supposed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but had certain questions against him concerning their own superstition and of one Jesus, who was dead and whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because I was in doubt as to this manner of questions, I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem, and there be judged on these matters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul appealed to be reserved for a hearing by Augustus, I commanded him to be kept until I might send him to Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus, “I would also hear the man myself.” “Tomorrow,” said he, “thou shalt hear him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the morrow, when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and had entered into the place of hearing with the chief captains and principal men of the city, at Festus’ command Paul was brought forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Festus said, “King Agrippa and all men who are here present with us, ye see this man about whom all the multitude of the Jews have applied to me, both at Jerusalem and also here, crying out that he ought not to live any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I found that he hath committed nothing worthy of death, and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of him I have nothing certain to write unto my lord. Therefore I have brought him forth before you, and especially before thee, O King Agrippa, that after we have examined him I might have something to write.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not also to specify the crimes laid against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, “Thou art permitted to speak for thyself.” Then Paul stretched forth his hand and answered for himself:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee concerning all the things whereof I am accused by the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews. Therefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My manner of life from my youth, which was from the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem, is known to all the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that according to the strictest sect of our religion, I lived as a Pharisee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I stand and am judged because of the hope of the promise made by God unto our fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto which promise our twelve tribes, earnestly serving God day and night, hope to come. For this hope’s sake, King Agrippa, I am accused by the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should it be thought an incredible thing by you that God should raise the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I myself verily thought that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which things I also did in Jerusalem; and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I gave my voice against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I punished them often in every synagogue, and compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly maddened against them, I persecuted them even unto foreign cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thereupon, as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, brighter than the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and those who journeyed with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, and saying in the Hebrew tongue, ‘Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou Me? It is hard for thee to kick against the goads.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘Who art Thou, Lord?’ And He said, ‘I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rise and stand upon thy feet, for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose: to make thee a minister and a witness, both of these things which thou hast seen, and of those things in which I will appear unto thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: delivering thee from the people and from the Gentiles unto whom now I send thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to open their eyes and to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith that is in Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thereupon, O King Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showed first unto those at Damascus and at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, and do works meet for repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these causes the Jews seized me in the temple and went about to kill me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having therefore obtained the help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying nothing other than what the prophets and Moses said should come:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Christ should suffer, and that He should be the first who should rise from the dead, and should show light unto the people and to the Gentiles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he thus spoke for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, “Paul, thou art beside thyself! Much learning doth make thee mad!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am not mad, most noble Festus, but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king himself knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely; for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him, for this thing was not done in a corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, “Thou almost persuadest me to be a Christian.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul said, “I would to God that not only thou, but also all who hear me this day, were both almost and altogether such as I am, except for these bonds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and also the governor and Bernice and those who sat with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had gone aside, they talked among themselves, saying, “This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus, “This man might have been set at liberty if he had not appealed unto Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was determined that we should sail to Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius, a centurion of Augustus’ band.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And entering into a ship from Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail along the coasts of Asia, one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day we touched at Sidon. And Julius courteously treated Paul, and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us aboard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had sailed slowly many days and scarcely had come as far as Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under the lee of Crete off Salmone;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, with difficulty passing by it, we came unto a place which is called The Fair Havens, nigh unto the city of Lasea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after much time had been lost, and when sailing was now dangerous because the Fast was now already past, Paul admonished them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto them, “Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be attended by hurt and much damage, not only to the lading and ship, but also to our lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship, rather than those things which were spoken by Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the greater number advised to depart thence also, hoping that by some means they might attain Phoenix, which is a haven of Crete and lieth toward the southwest and northwest, and there to winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, casting loose from thence, they sailed close by Crete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not long after, there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ship was caught and could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And running under the lee of a certain island, which is called Clauda, we had much work in securing the boat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which when they had taken up, they used helps to undergird the ship. And fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, they struck sail, and so were driven.
verses.speaker: Narrator
